description: President Donald Trump’s trade representative said that the US was nearing an announcement of a first tranche of trade deals that would see the White House reduce planned tariffs on trading partners, as fresh data fanned new doubts about the state of the economy.
title: Trump Trade Chief Says Tariff Deals ‘Close,’ More Meetings This Week

description: Donald Trump barely repelled a challenge to his global tariff offensive in the Republican-controlled US Senate as the president’s trade policy stokes public fears of inflation and recession.
title: Trump Barely Defeats Challenge to His Tariff War in Senate

description: President Donald Trump won’t succeed with his stated ambitions to expand US territory, according to Mark Carney, Canada’s newly-elected prime minister.
title: Trump Won’t Add Canada, Greenland or Panama to US Territory, Carney Says

description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson, a Republican from Louisiana, arrives at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Monday, April 28, 2025. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and congressional Republicans are meeting to sketch out the plan for passing a multi-trillion tax cut in the coming weeks as polling shows that voters largely disapprove of the White House's handling of the economy.
title: Pro-SALT Republicans, House Leaders Divided Over Tax Break

description: Track Australia's electorates, key seats and votes in real time.
title: Australia Election Live Results

description: The outcome of Australia’s tight federal election could be the next catalyst for local assets as a tariff standoff between the US and China continues to rattle markets.
title: An Investor’s Guide to Navigating the Australian Election

description: The US and Ukraine reached a deal over access to Ukraine’s natural resources Wednesday, a move that Kyiv sought to solidify President Donald Trump’s backing in ceasefire talks with Russia.
title: US and Ukraine Sign Agreement on Access to Natural Resources

description: The US urged India and Pakistan to work together to de-escalate tensions and avoid an expected clash, after militants last week killed dozens of people in the Indian-controlled portion of the disputed Himalayan region of Kashmir.
title: US Urges India and Pakistan to De-Escalate Amid Fears of Clash

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at today’s GDP report and the reaction in the White House. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s First Economic Scorecard Gets Marked With GDP Contraction

description: The European Union is planning to share a paper with the US next week that will set out a package of proposals to kick-start trade negotiations with the Trump administration.
title: EU to Present New Trade Proposals to US Negotiators Next Week

description: New York’s Long Island Rail Road, the nation’s largest commuter line, is bracing for potential delays as Amtrak plans to start years-long repair work on an East River tunnel that will limit service.
title: Amtrak’s Tunnel Shutdown Risks Long Island Rail Service

description: Tougher rules that were meant to shield problem gamblers from companies like Bet365 Group Ltd. and other industry giants were scrapped at the last minute by Australia’s main online gambling regulator, documents show, a decision that adds to allegations of inadequate corporate oversight in the world’s most prolific betting market.
title: Betting Giants Notch Up Win as Australia Ditches Stricter Rules

description: US President Donald Trump said newly elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney plans to visit the White House within the next week.
title: Loonie Gains on Trump Saying Carney Wants to Make a Deal

description: Brazil’s iconic yellow soccer jersey has become such a potent conservative political symbol that many leftists refuse to wear it. Now, rumors the team might don a different color with deep associations to the left at the 2026 World Cup are inflaming the right.
title: Brazil Denies Plans for Red Soccer World Cup Jersey After Political Backlash

description: Bank of Canada officials considered cutting interest rates at their April meeting before opting to wait for more information as they weighed the volatile changes in US President Donald Trump’s trade policy.
title: Trump’s ‘Erratic’ Tariff Policy Prompted Bank of Canada Pause

description: A Columbia University student detained by immigration officials was released by a federal judge as he fights the Trump administration’s attempts to remove him from the country.
title: Columbia Student Is Freed by US Judge as He Fights Deportation

description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss why India stands to gain from the US trade war with China and the rest of the world.
title: How Donald Trump Became India’s New Best Friend

description: US Supreme Court justices signaled a deep divide over a bid to create the nation’s first publicly funded religious charter school in a case that could lift longstanding constitutional limits on governmental support for faith.
title: Supreme Court Signals Deep Divide on Religious Charter Schools

description: Renewable energy and climate technology companies that flocked to the US to profit from the subsidies provided by the Biden administration’s Inflation Reduction Act are reassessing whether the US remains the optimal place to run a low-carbon business, according to a senior Citigroup Inc. banker.
title: Citi Banker Says Clients Consider Climate Investments Outside US

description: China removed sanctions against European lawmakers amid speculation that President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs could lead to a reset of relations with the European Union.
title: China Lifts Sanctions on European Lawmakers Amid Trump Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump blamed former President Joe Biden for weak economic data that sent stocks tumbling, arguing government data showed increased domestic investment signaled his tariff regime is working.
title: Trump Says He Deserves a ‘Pass’ on Data Showing GDP Contraction

description: A Romanian presidential contender echoed warnings from Donald Trump’s administration that Sunday’s election must refrain from “censoring opponents,” laying bare how the US president looms over the Black Sea nation’s contentious ballot.
title: Romanian Candidate Brandishes Trump Messaging in Presidency Bid

description: Negotiators from Ukraine are in Washington ironing out the final details of an agreement to develop the country’s natural resources that they hope will strengthen their economic partnership with the US, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Ukraine and US Working on Last Details of Critical Minerals Deal

description: Alphabet Inc. Chief Executive Officer Sundar Pichai said in court proceedings Wednesday that he hopes that Gemini, his company’s AI service, will be added as a built-in option for iPhones this year.
title: Google Eyes Gemini-iPhone AI Deal This Year, Pichai Tells Court

description: Trump’s second term begins with a decline in US GDP, while jobs and prices hold steady. On almost all fronts, the outlook is getting worse.
title: Trump Says He's Off to Best Start as President. The Economy Says Something Else

description: A federal judge lifted her weeklong pause on litigation that seeks to require the Trump administration to say what it has done to facilitate the return of a Maryland resident deported by mistake to an El Salvador prison.
title: Abrego Garcia Judge Says US Must Give Answers on His Return

description: Un análisis exclusivo muestra que las opiniones del presidente de EE.UU. sobre la guerra en Ucrania están cada vez más alineadas con las del Kremlin.
title: Mensaje de Trump a estadounidenses es lo que Putin quiere que escuchen sobre Ucrania

description: The Trump administration asked the US trade court to reject a lawsuit by small businesses challenging the president’s global tariffs, arguing that judges don’t have the authority to review the national emergency he invoked to justify the sweeping levies.
title: Trump Tells Court His Tariff Powers Can’t Be Reviewed by Judges

description: Ford Motor Co.’s chief executive officer said the tariff relief President Donald Trump extended to automakers is “reasonable” and “the right thing to do” while indicating more is needed to fully address the impact of his levies.
title: Ford CEO Says More Work Needed After Trump’s Auto Tariff Relief

description: App makers Meta Platforms Inc., Spotify Technology SA and Match Group Inc. are girding for a high-stakes political battle with the world’s two dominant smartphone platforms over who should take responsibility for verifying users’ ages.
title: Meta, App Makers Launch Washington Lobby to Fight Apple and Google

description: Bulgaria’s largest far-right party has signed a cooperation agreement with Russian President Vladimir Putin’s United Russia party, deepening anti-establishment ties with Moscow in the European Union’s most pro-Russian nation.
title: Bulgaria Far Right Party Signs Accord With Putin’s United Russia

description: Within 48 hours of a deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir on April 22, India had downgraded diplomatic ties with its neighbor Pakistan and vowed to suspend a crucial water-sharing treaty, while Pakistan had banned Indian planes from its airspace and halted cross-border trade.
title: What’s Behind the Enduring India-Pakistan Conflict?

description: An Israeli private investigator, alleged to have worked for a Washington lobbying firm and hacked climate activists, failed to block his extradition to face criminal charges in the US.
title: Alleged Israeli Hacker Loses Bid to Block Extradition to US

description: The United Arab Emirates said it thwarted an attempt to transfer weapons to Sudan’s army, the latest escalation in tensions between the Gulf power and military authorities in the North African nation torn apart by two years of civil war.
title: UAE Says It Foiled Bid to Transfer Weapons to Sudan’s Army

description: A high-stakes clash at the US Supreme Court threatens to upend the nation’s charter-school system and further strain an already challenged investment arena.
title: Supreme Court Case Is Vital for Future of Charter-School Funding

description: Argentine savers are going back to the bank to buy dollars after President Javier Milei granted them complete freedom to do so after five years of strict currency controls, at a time when many view the greenback as cheap.
title: Argentines Buying Up Dollars After Milei Lifts Currency Controls

description: Ukraine is ready to sign a natural resources deal with the US, a person familiar with the matter said, in a move that could bolster Washington’s support for Kyiv by strengthening their economic partnership.
title: Ukraine Ready to Sign US Resources Deal as Early as Wednesday

description: Israel is turning to markets in the Arabian Peninsula and India to boost trade as the government seeks to increase exports from $150 billion to almost $1 trillion over the next 15 years, according to Economy and Industry Minister Nir Barkat.
title: Israel to Expand Trade Eastward as It Looks Beyond War Economy

description: Canadian Conservatives are backing Pierre Poilievre despite losing the election to Mark Carney’s Liberals, saying the party made significant gains in the province of Ontario and among young voters.
title: Conservatives Praise Poilievre’s Gains Despite Election Loss

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Ghosts of Apartheid Amplify Ramaphosa’s Woes

description: The Philippines’ Department of National Defense is reviewing at least 50 security agreements, possibly including those with China, to weed out those that don’t align with national interest.
title: Philippines Reviews Defense Deals, May Include Those With China

description: A forum organized by Mali’s army-led government proposed that junta leader Assimi Goita remain in power five more years, the third West African nation under military control to impose such a delay in the return to civilian rule.
title: Mali Junta Leader Gets Backing to Serve as President Until 2030

description: Last week’s deadly attack on tourists in Indian-controlled Kashmir has raised a key question among opposition politicians and security experts alike: How could such a brazen massacre of civilians occur in broad daylight in one of the world’s most militarized areas?
title: India Seeks Answers on How 200,000 Troops Failed to Stop Attack

description: Russia intensified its attacks across Ukraine’s frontline and several cities as the success of US President Donald Trump’s efforts to bring a rapid end to the war look increasingly doubtful.
title: Russia Steps Up Attacks on Ukraine as US Ceasefire Push Stumbles

description: Estonia may contribute a company of soldiers to a potential peace-keeping mission in Ukraine as part of a “reassurance force” led by the UK and France, Prime Minister Kristen Michal said.
title: Estonia May Send Troops to Ukraine as Part of Potential Mission

description: A former head of the BLS on why gathering official statistics is getting harder.
title: Some of America’s Most Important Economic Data Is Decaying

description: A bipartisan group of US lawmakers are reintroducing legislation that aims to revive American shipbuilding, riding off momentum of an executive order from President Donald Trump announced earlier this month.
title: Lawmakers Revive Bipartisan Bill to Restore US Shipbuilding

description: Gathering official economic data is a huge process in the best of times. But a bunch of different things have now combined to make that process even harder. People aren’t responding to surveys like they used to. Survey responses have also become a lot more divided along political lines. And at the same time, the Trump administration wants to cut back on government spending, and the worry is that fewer official resources will make tracking the US economy even harder for statistical departments th
title: Odd Lots: Important US Economic Data Is Decaying (Podcast)

description: President Donald Trump’s eldest son wrapped up an eastern European tour that promoted the family’s growing business interests while opening channels to figures in the region who align with MAGA’s right-wing brand.
title: Trump Jr.’s East Europe Trip Mixes Money and Right-Wing Politics

description: Germany’s Social Democrats voted in favor of the coalition deal with Friedrich Merz’s conservatives, clearing the way for the CDU/CSU leader to be confirmed as chancellor next week.
title: German SPD Backs Coalition, Paving Way for Merz-led Government

description: Iran executed a man convicted of spying for Israel and accused of playing a key role in the assassination of an officer of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps, the state-run Mizan reported.
title: Iran Executes Man Accused of Being Top Spy for Israel’s Mossad

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez held a meeting Tuesday evening with executives from the country’s main utilities to discuss the blackout and plans going forward.
title: Spain’s Prime Minister Summoned Utilities to Discuss Blackout

description: Vietnam’s top leader said his nation is ready to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with the world’s great powers, as tens of thousands gathered to watch a military parade marking 50 years since the end of the war and the defeat of the US-backed southern regime.
title: Vietnam’s Lam Hails ‘Profound’ Lessons 50 Years After End of War

description: Strict export rules for arms threaten the country’s small but symbolically important industry in the wake of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
title: Switzerland’s Neutrality Is Holding Back Its Defense Industry

description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK Party is poised to emerge as the biggest winner in England’s local elections on Thursday, potentially laying the ground for a wider fracturing of British politics and the end of the country’s traditional Labour-Conservative duopoly.
title: Nigel Farage’s Rise Drives Cracks in Britain’s Two-Party System

description: The Philippines and New Zealand signed a deal on military visits that bolsters the two nations’ security ties.
title: Philippines, New Zealand Sign Visiting Forces Agreement

description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese could become the first Australian leader in more than two decades to win consecutive terms in office, with polls showing his center-left government is in the lead ahead of a national election on May 3.
title: Who’s Likely to Win Australia’s Election and What’s at Stake?

description: China’s top legislature passed a bill aimed at boosting the private sector, in a symbolic move to rally entrepreneurs and shore up confidence as Beijing hunkers down for a “protracted” trade war with the US.
title: China Adopts Law to Protect Private Companies Amid Trade War

description: China’s factory activity slipped into the worst contraction since December 2023, revealing early damage to the world’s second-biggest economy from the trade war with the US.
title: China’s Factory Activity at Slowest Since 2023 as US Tariffs Hit

description: President Donald Trump said that fraud allegedly uncovered by Elon Musk’s government cost-cutting team had been referred to the Justice Department for criminal investigation.
title: Trump Says DOGE Has Prompted Justice Department Referrals

description: The ruling People’s Action Party has dominated the city-state for six decades
title: In Singapore’s Election, Success Is Less About Who Wins Than by How Much
